title: Stocks - U.S. Futures Surge as U.S-China Agree to Trade Talks in October
text:
© Reuters.

Investing.com - U.S. futures jumped on Thursday after China confirmed high-level trade talks with Washington would be held in October, prompting hopes that the trade war can be de-escalated.

rose 94 points or 1.2% by 6:42 AM ET (10:42 GMT), while gained 252 points or 1% and were up 26 points or 0.9%.

The talks were agreed to over the phone, the Chinese Commerce Ministry said, which was confirmed by a spokesman for the U.S. Trade Representative's office. No terms of the talks were given.

U.S. tariffs on over $100 billion worth of Chinese goods went into effect on Sept. 1 and plans to increase rates to 30% from 25% on another $250 billion worth of Chinese imports are set for Oct. 1.

Tesla (NASDAQ: ) rose 0.8%, while Facebook (NASDAQ: ) and Netflix (NASDAQ: ) gained 1%. PayPal (NASDAQ: ) jumped 1%, while Ford Motor Company (NYSE: ) was up 1.1%.

Enterprise software group Cloudera (NYSE: ) surged 12.3% after its earnings came in better than expected, helped by a record contribution from its partnership with IBM (NYSE: ).

Slack (NYSE: ) slumped 12.8% after it forecast a slightly larger-than-expected loss per share for the fiscal third-quarter in its first earnings report since the company went public. The shares have fallen nearly 20% since the initial public offering.

On the economic front, the report comes out at 8:15 AM, with the latest weekly at 8:30 AM. A final reading of services (PMI) for August, data for August, and for July will also be released at 10:00 AM.

In commodities, fell 0.1% to $56.19 a barrel. were down 0.8% to $1,547.75 a troy ounce, while the , which measures the greenback against a basket of six major currencies, was down 0.2% to 98.172.
